channel.title: Please help!
channel.description:
So okay i downloaded the silab's client and i opened run.bat and the client says:
Connection error - retrying in ** secs... What do i need to do? i downloaded java..

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

aimx1:

im asking for a silab client help… not mopar

This is Silab help. You are trying to run a client without a cache. The cache it is looking for is the MoparScape client cache. Since you don’t have it, you are getting an error. If you choose to not believe in what I am saying, you won’t ever get Silab’s client up and running.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

Tico135:

Monkey, sorry to burst your bubble, but your wrong. The only way is to download the MoparScape 3.2 w/ Aryan client. Run it, and it will download the cache. To run Silab’s client that is what you need. You can download it from here.

I was figuring that he has already installed moparscape oh well

And if you haven’t download moparscape silabs client won’t rune!

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

[code]How do I set the PATH permanently?
To set the PATH permanently, add the full path of the jdk1.6.0_\bin directory to the PATH variable. Typically this full path looks something like C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_\bin. Set the PATH as follows on Microsoft Windows:

  1. Click Start > Control Panel > System on Windows XP or Start > Settings > Control Panel > System on Windows 2000.

  2. Click Advanced > Environment Variables.

  3. Add the location of bin folder of JDK installation for PATH in User Variables and System Variables. A typical value for PATH is:

    C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_\bin

* PATH environment variable is a series of directories separated by semi-colons (;) and is not case sensitive. Microsoft Windows looks for programs in the PATH directories in order, from left to right.
* You should only have one bin directory for a JDK in the path at a time. Those following the first instance are ignored. If one is already present, update it to jdk1.6.0_<version>\bin.
* If you are not sure where to add the path, add it to the right end of the PATH in the User Variables.
* The new path takes effect in each new command window you open after setting the PATH variable.

[/code]

JDK is below:

https://sdlc1d.sun.com/ECom/EComActionServlet/DownloadPage:~:com.sun.sunit.sdlc.content.DownloadPageInfo;jsessionid=01860385D200A6571B336735AFEF28A8;jsessionid=01860385D200A6571B336735AFEF28A8
THEN DOWNLOAD THE WINDOWS VERSION OR WHAT EVER TYPE OF COMP YOU HAVE!

or

http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/netbeans.html

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

TRY THE BELOW STEPS!
1.click out of run.bat screen
2.click run.bat

HAPPENS AGAIN?
1.Make sure you have jdk installed
2.Make sure you class paths are set
3.Restart you computer
4.try run.bat again!
